p: In the next two sections I reflect mainly on experiences in the courtroom itself, focusing particularly on two recurring and dialectically opposing themes respectively: the court as a theatre of power and place of suppression and punishment – where settler-colonial manipulations of both civil and criminal contempt labels play out to suit extractive agendas and arbitrary logic; and the courtroom as a space of contrasting ideas of ‘irreparable harm’ and a place of critical solidarity-building. These themes are addressed respectively in the following two sections.
